title: Im a broken man.
body:
So you finally did it, you broke me.

Lost 4 divisions because i dont have the skill to carry literal anchors for teammates.

Everywhere i look i cant find anywhere i can improve my play aside from coaching (im talking guides here, i know exactly what areas im lacking in skill wise but cant find solid guides for em)

gold fricken game knowledge but wood 7 mechanics makes for a very unhappy elo climb.

Im sitting here reading prices for elo boosts just sighing to myself because i cant afford them.

This is what its come too, ranked used to be fun, but now all i do is split push all game because it works slightly more consistently than other things.

now im going to go play a game that has a yorick jg and fiddlesticks mid...

this elo makes me want to cry.

replies.body: People take this game too seriously. Sure, everyone wants to win but people don't focus on improving yourself. You mentioned you split push, if you split push you'd obviously be heavily farmed and in turn have items. Do you use this to your advantage by helping other lanes? Or simply sit top and push, because that could also be your downfall by essentially making it a 4v5. Unless you can get an inhib, splitpushing is never that beneficial apart from gold, especially in a lane like top.

I always get inhibs.

Its bronze the second you just afk push top they freak the fuck out and dont know how to counter it.

The issue is my teams tend to also freak the fuck out 9/10

The other 1 time is a golden moment when my team realises they have free objectives literally right infront of them.

Granted my last game is an example of how i am visibly more skilled than my teams.

48 minutes in and 425 cs later i killed literally every turret and inhib on the enemy team while also being the sole member of my team fed enough to defend against the 5 fed monstrosities knocking down our door (22/2 ezreal as an example, 12/1 darius, etc etc)

I somehow managed to make a game that shouldve ended at 20 minutes (when they reached our nexus) last an extra 28 minutes and somehow found the time to simultaneously defend and push at the same time.

Honestly had my team been slightly more skilled and able to fight without me i mightve actually won that game.

Just barely though, granted then again if they were more skilled the team wouldnt have gotten fed in the first place.

Edit: Just want to note when i say visibly more skilled i mean in reference with the rest of my elo.

Contrary to popular belief there is a niche skill level where you can get stuck in an elo.

The only way to describe this niche is when you are visibly performing better than those around you but are not quite good enough to climb to the next tier.

A dwarf among gnomes if you will, when to climb you need to be a giant, to quote foxdrop. This niche is of course what i call elo hell, i respect that there is trolls in every elo and thats why i dont class elo hell as where all the trolls are, i class it as the elo where you are better but not quite good enough, granted the trick with this niche is that artificially increasing your elo by boosting or duoing also increases your winrate, as you get past the elo plateau and into an elo where you are playing equally with those around you rather than better.

Another way to put it is this, you have carried yourself to a point where you can no longer 1v5 for a penta, but at the same time both your opponents and your team are still not on your level, at this point your winrate will drop until you are equaled out with your opponents and team.

I dislike the first thing you say. "Its bronze the second you just afk push top they freak the fuck out and dont know how to counter it.". This isn't true. They will have two split off and kill you, and you will have wasted time on top lane.

Bronze isn't full of idiots, it's made up of a majority of idiots with some actual good players either keeping themselves in bronze (it happens, good players like to scrub stomp), or actual decent players with a few mechanical/map awareness/teamfight problems.

Except sending two people after me isnt a counter.

I just looked you up and you are bronze 5 so i understand why you think you know how to counter it, but ill explain why you're wrong.

If you send 2 people to gank the split pushing top you have just created a 3v4 situation in every other lane.

My team now has the capability to just group up as 4 and take a turret or dragon because there is only 3 people who can actually defend.

A good place to push would be bot as itd make it impossible for your team to send the reinforcements they need to stop my team taking a turret.

What this means is that by trying to stop me from taking a turret you have given my team 3 kills and a turret or dragon.

The proper way to counter a top lane split push would be to have your top laner roam with your team for a 5v4 situation against my team and when my team is significantly weakened send people back top to deal with me, there is no bronzie alive that i have seen do this, and i have a few hundred games where ive done this.

Infact not only do people not know how to counter it, but if i had a good early laning phase then sending two people after me just gives me 2 kills and lets me push even faster because i now know there is only 3 people on the map and 90% of the time i know exactly where they all are.

And for the final kicker, i always ward enemy jungle so even if you send the two most fed assholes you have ill just leave lane before you can get the kill, then come back when you are gone, which means youve both wasted your time and have to send them again wasting more time.

I might be bronze 5 but I have consistently better scores than you. This means my enemy teams are getting fed less from me, which would mean they would have a harder time fighting split pushers, right?

Wrong. It all depends on your champ. But, even with a specifically dedicated split pusher (tryndamere and Trundle come to mind), if two people split off to deal with you, heck, if one person splits off and just dicks around the tower poking you when you try to push it and clearing the minions when they get to the tower. You're now useless, as split pushers work well when you can get towers down.

Split pushing is not instant win in bronze. I've tried and it fails. Everybody knows how to deal with it in bronze, it's not hard.

Basically everything you've said is countered by the fact that your scores alone on your latest games attest otherwise. You don't get kills, you die a lot, this leads me to believe you don't counter your counter-pushers and in reality you split push, get picked off from your team and die.

Bronze should focus on teaming up past 20 minutes, looking to force fights around towers/dragon/baron, and to pick off carries once engagement begins. The problem with bronze is people focus tanks/scary looking champs like darius, and don't focus the tristana that's getting free attacks into your team. They also don't group, they split-push, get picked off and die.
The problem is that because you die so much (yes I'm going back to deaths, and yes you die A LOT) you are feeding the enemy team so hard that they can successfully defend 3v4
then use the yellow bricks to build yourself back up

Bloodborne is easily the most unrelentingly difficult game I've ever played, and I've played through it three times now all without getting one tenth as pissed off as I've gotten in a single League game.

Fuck this game off, Riot doesn't care about its playerbase anyway. Come add me on PSN and play something worthwhile.

as someone who is currently just breezing through his first dark souls 2 play-through wearing that armor you get by killing the merchant (the really shit armor that gives you more souls) and the starting weapons.

I can confirm league and legends is harder than dark souls 2.

Like legit i bought this game to play the dark souls drinking game and at this rate im not even going to get tipsy let alone drunk.

On that note i am pc master-race (no i do not play on a toaster, i actually have 2 seperate game ready pc's ones a stream box the other a beastie) so i dont have a playstation anything, i might buy one when there are some decent exclusives i want to play on it, but until then its just pc and Nintendo for me.

if you lack mechanics i suggest playing garen and amumu. very easy mechanics ( one skill shot between the two of them ) and are beast in low elo cos no one knows how to play against them. seriuosly carried myself out with amumu by getting 4 - 5 man ults every game cos bronze are just to silly to spread out. garen is simple in low elo is you know his damage but gets hard as you climb. good team fighting champs just get team to group.

You have to understand that playing just as you see someone playing in a diamond or challenger game will not carry games in bronze. There's plenty of extra stuff you can be taking advantage of but there is also things you will have to do differently to account for the lack of knowledge/skill from your team. Being able to identify what these are in any given game and adapt accordingly is real game knowledge.

And a big problem is that you're playing tryndamere. Sure, the enemy team won't know how to deal with a split push in bronze, but your teammates won't know how to play appropriately either. Getting an inhib isn't worth it if your team is going to die and give the enemies 4 kills AND an inhib. Saying "just play safe" etc. will not work in bronze, and if you've given a bunch of kills to the enemy team (which clearly you do because most of your scores suck), your teammates might not be able to defend even if they do know what they're doing, and probably won't get anything if you get gangbanged 3v1. Unless you can consistently get fed enough to actually kill several people every time they come top, don't play split pushers in bronze.

Well whats the alternative then.

Go play akali mid and not be able to push lanes.

Go play thresh support and not be able to duel if i have to.

There is no fucking alternative in this elo, i dont have the mechanics to go 20/0 with zed and 1v5

I dont have the mechanics to snowball with riven

All i have is game knowledge, last hitting and map awareness.

I cant rely on other people at all, this is a 1v9 game, so ill keep doing what works until someone gives me a better idea.

One look at your match history and its clear that its not simply a matter of "I can't carry hard enough". You're actively losing the game for your team in a large amount of your games, and I'd probably be hard pressed to find one where you truely carried. The faster you realise that its more than just your mechanics that are lacking, the faster you can actually improve. If your game knowledge was really as good as you seem to think, you wouldn't be stuck in bronze, I have the mechanics of a potato and I'm in plat. Play simple champs and learn to identify and exploit enemy mistakes, you don't need to mechanically outplay anyone to get extremely fed in bronze, people will gift you kills all over the place, you just need to be able to spot when they're giving you the opportnities and not let them get away with it for free.

This is actually fairly accurate, one of my biggest tips to a friend of mine who was bronze (key word is was), was that too often he had kill potential and didn't realize it, and this is the case with a lot of low elo players, where you can get away with so much simply because your enemy tends to lack the knowledge to know your a dead man if they all in.
If you admit that you lack the mechanics, then why will you not admit that you belong in bronze? The game is a combination of a lot of skills. Game knowledge alone doesn't net you gold

No one skill can net you gold im aware of this.

But i am lacking in a singular skill.

Like fuck i pull 70-80 cs by the 10 minute mark while being constantly harassed because bronze players only know how to be super aggressive.

there is no way that someone who is only lacking in mechanics is supposed to be low tier bronze.


LIke fuck all my silver 2 mates are only slightly ahead of me when it comes to gameplay, the only difference is that they had the mechanics to carry themselves out even though i have the superior game knowledge.

And mechanics isnt something you just magically get by changing your attitude.

When i say mechanics i dont mean "do i engage or not here" i mean "k so i ult onto them q this guy ult onto that guy then ult out on the lee sin but q auto him for good measure" Thats what id envision as a good akali triple kill.

If i tried to do that id probably ult onto a minion because i missed a targeted ability then get cc'd to death

> there is no way that someone who is only lacking in mechanics is supposed to be low tier bronze.

To be frank. 

If you are currently there and can not get higher you are supposed to be there.

I think the key to mechanics is just to practice over and over again.. like When I first started playing Irelia and I had no Idea what I was doing but after a few games of only playing her I was able to pull off some awesome things I didn't even know was possible. So don't say you lack the mechanics, just practice more and more in normal's with a few different rolls (encase you don't get the one you want) until you feel confident. Then you have to feel like winning the game before you can win. If you go into a game thinking you will loose or your team will weigh you down ... chances are they will. But if you start if off with a good attitude and congratulation team mates who do well then your chances at winning increase hugely.

>gold fricken game knowledge but wood 7 mechanics makes for a very unhappy elo climb.

Thing is mechanics means a lot more then game knowledge, especially in solo queue where everyone assumes they know everything.

Im aware of this, its why i have such a bad time climbing.

My mechanics are ok enough to not feed in a 1v1 situation, i just cant go uber pro and 1v5 carry.

its literally the only reason i hold my own at higher elo's sure im not able to blow peoples minds with an insec, but atleast i know how to make a non retarded baron call and build properly, atleast i know how to control a lane, etc etc.

Well apparently since i posted this i put my carry hat back on and started destroying noobs haha.

Lets hope it lasts this time.
